Articles.Content:
I must apologise, I completely misunderstood the original statement you made.

The only possible way eve could be so dark is... I don't know, a unique element that's undiscovered?

Why must clouds all be the same colour anyway? Why not have a subtle mixture of lighter clouds at high altitude and darker ones at the lower altitudes? Then it stands up in theory (reflecting lots of light, radiation etc) and also looks nice

Lots of light would get reflected by the upper clouds leaving small amounts of light lower down.

- - - Updated - - -

What does Kerbin's aurora look like from the surface (regarding that screenshot)?

Here you go:
wow i bet its not long till the release of V5

Here you go:

http://i.imgur.com/xLy0xVS.png

Oooo that looks great! Looking forward to V5!

I must apologise, I completely misunderstood the original statement you made.

The only possible way eve could be so dark is... I don't know, a unique element that's undiscovered?

Why must clouds all be the same colour anyway? Why not have a subtle mixture of lighter clouds at high altitude and darker ones at the lower altitudes? Then it stands up in theory (reflecting lots of light, radiation etc) and also looks nice

Lots of light would get reflected by the upper clouds leaving small amounts of light lower down.

- - - Updated - - -

What does Kerbin's aurora look like from the surface (regarding that screenshot)?

That's exactly what I thought too. I messed arround with the clouds a bit, and managed to get this effect. The top laer of clouds as well as atomo layer are bright magenta and as you descend they turn into darker and darker purple and ultimately they shift into very dark green (hardly visible from orbit, in orbit the clouds are very bright, almost white magenta with streaks of purple where top cover breaks. I had to move layer 0 to the top and to get this effect cause apparently EVE always displays layer 0 on top, no matter what the actual (altitude induced) order is). I also added one additional layer between each 2, so now with volumetric clouds enabled, the cover is continuous. Once you enter clouds at 15 km you descend through the soup that gets darker and darker until they break right above surface.

I'm gonna post some screenshots later, if that's ok with you, Sonic.

Hi,

I have installed this pack. The kerbin looks so beautiful now but the mun looks worse. I mean it is like it has atmosphere which makes craters barely visible. Is there an option to only restore to default mun?
HM... What if I say Jool look too green-ish? I like the V4 version more because it got contrast between green and white.
I think I found a bug

That's exactly what I thought too. I messed arround with the clouds a bit, and managed to get this effect. The top laer of clouds as well as atomo layer are bright magenta and as you descend they turn into darker and darker purple and ultimately they shift into very dark green (hardly visible from orbit, in orbit the clouds are very bright, almost white magenta with streaks of purple where top cover breaks. I had to move layer 0 to the top and to get this effect cause apparently EVE always displays layer 0 on top, no matter what the actual (altitude induced) order is). I also added one additional layer between each 2, so now with volumetric clouds enabled, the cover is continuous. Once you enter clouds at 15 km you descend through the soup that gets darker and darker until they break right above surface.

I'm gonna post some screenshots later, if that's ok with you, Sonic.

Sure. Be sure to post them in an album.

Hi,

I have installed this pack. The kerbin looks so beautiful now but the mun looks worse. I mean it is like it has atmosphere which makes craters barely visible. Is there an option to only restore to default mun?

The mun is getting an overhaul in V5. You can go to the tracking station and hit ALT+N on the Mun and click the remove button until it's all fixed.

HM... What if I say Jool look too green-ish? I like the V4 version more because it got contrast between green and white.

I dunno..The lines seemed too perfect. I'll try to make the colors lighter and darker.

I think I found a bug

I've also been working on a draft for the new thread when V5 comes out. I've got a new name too. Excpect V5 to come out around in around 1-2 weeks. All depending on the new release of EVE.

Edited May 19, 2014 by Grunf911

Just a quick a request... please make Tylo's atmosphere a bit less intense at lower altitudes - like the changes you are making to Mun. Basically, when I'm orbiting at 30 km, I see a semi-thick atmosphere around Tylo (it's not that bad, just slightly on the thick side). On the surface, it's fine.

I also have a question - is there an option to extend the draw distance of volumetric clouds? I have a semi-powerful three-year old laptop that I think would be able to handle that. I just want to be able to see spectacular cloud formations below me while I aerobrake around Jool, if possible.

Anyway, I love all the changes that are being made! They all look spectacular!

Just a quick a request... please make Tylo's atmosphere a bit less intense at lower altitudes - like the changes you are making to Mun. Basically, when I'm orbiting at 30 km, I see a semi-thick atmosphere around Tylo (it's not that bad, just slightly on the thick side). On the surface, it's fine.

I also have a question - is there an option to extend the draw distance of volumetric clouds? I have a semi-powerful three-year old laptop that I think would be able to handle that. I just want to be able to see spectacular cloud formations below me while I aerobrake around Jool, if possible.

Anyway, I love all the changes that are being made! They all look spectacular!

1. Yeah, that's what i've been planning with Mun, Ike, and Tylo.

2.Yeah, but it's going to be way more intese than you think. Go into the EVE folder(Not boulderco) and you should see a cfg file. The first number in the cfg file is the draw distance(this however spreads them out, not just making more at farther distances), the second one is how bunched up they are(which is what you need to up the number on to have them more bunched up at higher draw distances). Though Jool can't have any Volumetric clouds. I could be completely wrong but I remember hearing that it's because Jool has no PQS which is what the VC's need.

As usual, would like Feedback. If there should be any color changes let me know. Erona gave me some new Auroras for Jool. Which i also put on Laythe and Eve. The new project is going to be shown soon once I'm happy with it.
